thread.title: Neuberger Berman Names Alan Isenberg As Head Of Product Strategy And Marketing

author: cnbc.com
title: Neuberger Berman Names Alan Isenberg As Head Of Product Strategy And Marketing
text:
NEW YORK, March 12, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Neuberger Berman , a global, independent, employee-owned investment manager, today announced that Alan Isenberg has joined to lead the firm's Product Strategy and Marketing efforts globally.
Mr. Isenberg will be located initially in the firm's Hong Kong office. Asia Pacific represents nearly $50 billion of the firm's $295 billion assets under management. His responsibilities are global.
Over the last several years, Neuberger Berman's global client base of institutions, intermediary partners, financial advisors, and high net worth families has grown in number and geographic diversity. Alan Isenberg will lead internal teams including: Product Development, Product Management, Marketing, Thought Leadership, Digital Strategy, and Media Relations.
Mr. Isenberg joins from PIMCO, most recently serving as Head of Strategy & Business Management for Asia Pacific. At that same firm, he spent several years working with U.S. public pension plans. Prior roles include time as a Political Producer for CNN and a reporter at Newsweek International. He holds an MBA in International Finance and Economics from The Wharton School, a JD from Stanford Law School, and B.A. from the University of Pennsylvania.
Mr. Isenberg will report to Chief Operating Officer and Head of Client Coverage Andy Komaroff, who said, "Alan continues our success in attracting passionate, focused, experienced professionals with diverse perspectives to join our private firm. I'm confident he will enhance our engagement and deepen our connectivity with the clients we are fortunate to serve across all of our channels."
"I am honored to be joining Neuberger Berman having admired its culture, differentiated investment solutions, and thoughtful alignment to client needs," said Mr. Isenberg.
About Neuberger Berman
Neuberger Berman, founded in 1939, is a private, independent, employee-owned investment manager. The firm manages a range of strategies—including equity, fixed income, quantitative and multi-asset class, private equity and hedge funds—on behalf of institutions, advisors and individual investors globally. With offices in 20 countries, Neuberger Berman's team is approximately 1,900 professionals. For five consecutive years, the company has been named to Pensions & Investments Best Places to Work in Money Management survey (among those with 1,000 employees or more). Tenured, stable and long-term in focus, the firm fosters an investment culture of fundamental research and independent thinking. It manages $295 billion in client assets as of December 31, 2017.
